newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Dickson shares slightly up before news.
newsitem.headline: Dickson shares slightly up before news.

text.p: Shares of Dickson Concepts (International) Ltd traded slightly higher but in thin trade on Thursday as investors awaited an announcement from the company at a news conference scheduled later, analysts said.
The Hong Kong retailer said it would "announce updates on our international investment" at 3.45 pm (0745 GMT).
The stock rose HK$0.05 to HK$27.95 on 125,300 shares.
"Some people guess it may related to Barney's Inc," one analyst said.

Dickson said last December it was reviewing the financial position of U.S. luxury retailer Barney's and would consider whether to propose investing in the company. Dickson is one of at least three potential parties negotiating with Barney's.
The analyst said it may be too early however for Dickson to announce a deal.
Barney's, which has been operating in bankruptcy for more than a year, has been given until until May 5 by a U.S. bankruptcy court to file a reorganisation plan.
